name: Clin T Skin
title: Clinical T
notes:
**Note 1:**  T1 and T2 categories are based on size and high risk features and not depth of invasion or extension. 

**Note 2:** T3 category is for head and neck skin primaries only.

**Note 3:**  Code the tumor with the greatest extension when there are multiple simultaneous tumors. 

**Note 4:**  Skin ulceration does not alter the T category. 

**Note 5:** Tumor size must be known to assign a value of T1 or T2. You may use a physicianâ€™s statement of the T category if this is the only information in the medical record.
* If the tumor appears to be in the T1 or T2 categories, but no size or category is specified, assign TX

**Note 6:** Assign the appropriate T category (T1, T2) based on the tumor size for the following descriptions

    Lesion(s) confined to dermis
    Subcutaneous tissue (through entire dermis)
    Underlying cartilage and/or skeletal muscle

    Confined to skin
    Localized, NOS
rows:
Clinical classification criteria met, evaluation done: 
    Physician unable to assess T
    Extension cannot be determined 
    Tumor size (TS) unknown for T categories where TS  needed to determine T
Physician assigns cTX, no other information available to determine T

Tumor 2 cm or less in greatest dimension 
WITH less than two-high risk features

Lesion(s) confined to dermis
Subcutaneous tissue (through entire dermis)
Underlying cartilage and/or skeletal muscle

Stated as T1

Tumor more than 2 cm in greatest dimension OR 
WITH two or more high-risk features

Tumor with invasion of deep structures 
     e.g., muscle, bone, cartilage, jaws, and orbit

For skin of head and neck primaries only:
     Maxilla
     Mandible
     Orbital bone
     Temporal bone

Stated as T3
Tumor with direct or perineural invasion of skull base or axial skeleton

For skin of head and neck primaries only:
     Direct or perineural invasion of skull base

Axial or appendicular skeleton

Further contiguous extension 

Stated as T4

Primary site/histology not TNM defined
Death certificate only (DCO) case

Clinical classification criteria not met 
Clinical classification criteria met, evaluation done:
    No information about diagnostic workup
    Results not documented in record
Clinical evaluation of primary tumor not done or unknown if done
Tumor first detected on surgical resection (no clinical workup)
Evidence of metastatic disease [(cM1) or (pM1)], no other workup
Only Clinical Stage Group documented (no T, N, or M information available)
